properties.name: Ids
properties.help: One or more resource IDs (space-delimited). If provided, no other 'Resource Id' arguments should be specified.

properties.name: Name
properties.help: The resource name to validate.

properties.name: Subscription
properties.help: Name or ID of subscription. You can configure the default subscription using `az account set -s NAME_OR_ID`.

properties.name: Subscription
properties.help: Name or ID of subscription. You can configure the default subscription using `az account set -s NAME_OR_ID`.

properties.name: Name
properties.help: Name of the CDN profile which is unique within the resource group.

properties.name: ResourceGroup
properties.help: Name of resource group. You can configure the default group using `az configure --defaults group=&lt;name&gt;`.

properties.name: Location
properties.help: Location. You can configure the default location using `az configure --defaults location=&lt;location&gt;`.

properties.name: Sku
properties.help: The pricing tier (defines a CDN provider, feature list and rate) of the CDN profile. Defaults to Standard_Akamai.

properties.name: Tags
properties.help: Space-separated tags in 'key[=value]' format. Use "" to clear existing tags.

properties.help: Name or ID of subscription. You can configure the default subscription using `az account set -s NAME_OR_ID`.

properties.name: Add
properties.help: Add an object to a list of objects by specifying a path and key value pairs.  Example: --add property.listProperty <key=value, string or JSON string>.

properties.name: ForceString
properties.help: When using 'set' or 'add', preserve string literals instead of attempting to convert to JSON.

properties.name: Remove
properties.help: Remove a property or an element from a list.  Example: --remove property.list <indexToRemove> OR --remove propertyToRemove.

properties.name: Set
properties.help: Update an object by specifying a property path and value to set.  Example: --set property1.property2=<value>.

properties.name: Ids
properties.help: One or more resource IDs (space-delimited). If provided, no other 'Resource Id' arguments should be specified.

properties.name: Name
properties.help: Name of the origin which is unique within the endpoint.

properties.name: ResourceGroup
properties.help: Name of resource group. You can configure the default group using `az configure --defaults group=&lt;name&gt;`.

properties.name: Subscription
properties.help: Name or ID of subscription. You can configure the default subscription using `az account set -s NAME_OR_ID`.

properties.name: Name
properties.help: Name of the CDN endpoint.

properties.name: Origin
properties.help: Endpoint origin specified by the following space-delimited 3 tuple: `www.example.com http_port https_port`. The HTTP and HTTPsports are optional and will default to 80 and 443 respectively.

properties.name: ProfileName
properties.help: Name of the CDN profile which is unique within the resource group.

properties.name: ResourceGroup
properties.help: Name of resource group. You can configure the default group using `az configure --defaults group=&lt;name&gt;`.

properties.name: ContentTypesToCompress
properties.help: List of content types on which compression applies. The value should be a valid MIME type.

properties.name: EnableCompression
properties.help: If compression is enabled, content will be served as compressed if user requests for a compressed version. Content won't be compressed on CDN when requested content is smaller than 1 byte or larger than 1 MB.

properties.name: Location
properties.help: Location. You can configure the default location using `az configure --defaults location=&lt;location&gt;`.

properties.name: NoHttp
properties.help: Indicates whether HTTP traffic is not allowed on the endpoint. Default is to allow HTTP traffic.

properties.name: NoHttps
properties.help: Indicates whether HTTPS traffic is not allowed on the endpoint. Default is to allow HTTPS traffic.

properties.name: OriginHostHeader
properties.help: The host header value sent to the origin with each request. If you leave this blank, the request hostname determines this value. Azure CDN origins, such as Web Apps, Blob Storage, and Cloud Services require this host header value to match the origin hostname by default.

properties.name: OriginPath
properties.help: A directory path on the origin that CDN can use to retreive content from, e.g. contoso.cloudapp.net/originpath.

properties.name: QueryStringCaching
properties.help: Defines how CDN caches requests that include query strings. You can ignore any query strings when caching, bypass caching to prevent requests that contain query strings from being cached, or cache every request with a unique URL.

properties.name: Tags
properties.help: Space-separated tags in 'key[=value]' format. Use "" to clear existing tags.

properties.name: Subscription
properties.help: Name or ID of subscription. You can configure the default subscription using `az account set -s NAME_OR_ID`.

properties.name: ProfileName
properties.help: Name of the CDN profile which is unique within the resource group.

properties.help: One or more resource IDs (space-delimited). If provided, no other 'Resource Id' arguments should be specified.

properties.name: Subscription
properties.help: Name or ID of subscription. You can configure the default subscription using `az account set -s NAME_OR_ID`.

properties.name: ContentPaths
properties.help: The path to the content to be loaded. Path should be a relative file URL of the origin.

properties.name: ProfileName
properties.help: Name of the CDN profile which is unique within the resource group.

properties.name: EnableCompression
properties.help: If compression is enabled, content will be served as compressed if user requests for a compressed version. Content won't be compressed on CDN when requested content is smaller than 1 byte or larger than 1 MB.

properties.name: NoHttp
properties.help: Indicates whether HTTP traffic is not allowed on the endpoint. Default is to allow HTTP traffic.

properties.name: NoHttps
properties.help: Indicates whether HTTPS traffic is not allowed on the endpoint. Default is to allow HTTPS traffic.

properties.name: OriginHostHeader
properties.help: The host header value sent to the origin with each request. If you leave this blank, the request hostname determines this value. Azure CDN origins, such as Web Apps, Blob Storage, and Cloud Services require this host header value to match the origin hostname by default.

properties.name: OriginPath
properties.help: A directory path on the origin that CDN can use to retreive content from, e.g. contoso.cloudapp.net/originpath.

properties.name: QueryStringCaching
properties.help: Defines how CDN caches requests that include query strings. You can ignore any query strings when caching, bypass caching to prevent requests that contain query strings from being cached, or cache every request with a unique URL.

commonTaskProperties.name: Debug
commonTaskProperties.help: Increase logging verbosity to show all debug logs.
